results.title: Brahms and his music
results.brief_description: Recreates Brahm’s life among scenes closely associated with his development as a composer. These include Vienna, where he reached the height of his career, and the German countryside he loved. Excerpts from the following are included: Sonata No.3 in F for Piano; Symphony No.1; Symphony No.2, and the D Major Violin Concerto.

results.title: The Boyhood of Thomas Edison
results.brief_description: Dramatised incidents from the boyhood of Edison - his sitting on eggs to hatch them, his early experiments with chemicals and electricity, the newspaper he published on a train, provide an insight into his character traits. His curiosity, persistence, ingenuity, and his ability to learn through observation, qualities which later helped him change the world.

results.title: Crisis intervention. Pt. 4: Boy-girl relationships
results.brief_description: An open-ended film which presents a crisis intervention telephone conversation between a hotline listener and a fifteen-year-old girl who is considering using sex to keep her boyfriend. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Boy with a knife
results.brief_description: A powerful re-enactment of a case story from the files of a Los Angeles Youth Service Agency. Shows how a group worker attempts to reach a gang of boys who are headed for delinquency; he plans a preventative action and shows how he attempts to carry out the plans.

results.title: A Boy of the Netherlands
results.brief_description: The experiences of a Dutch farm boy when he travels by cargo barge to Amsterdam along the canals of Holland. He learns about life on board ship; and something of the industries of his country. The highlight of his visit to Amsterdam is a tour of city shops. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: A Boy of the Navajos
results.brief_description: This is the story of Tony Hotinez a present-day Navajo boy. It recounts his adventures as he herds sheep in the Arizona desert, spends evenings with his family in their hogan, and takes an exciting trip to the trading post, where Tony sells the drawings of the Navajos and of their customs which he has made. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: A Boy of the circus
results.brief_description: Dino, the only one of his family not employed at the circus, visits an opening performance to try to interest them in giving him a job. We see how circus people work together to produce a spectacle in which Dino finally plays a part.
